#Text=Wikinews interviews Donald K. Allen , independent candidate for US presidency
#Text=Thursday , October 2 , 2008

#Text=While nearly all mainstream coverage of the 2008 Presidential election has focused on the Democratic and Republican candidates , the race for the White House also includes independents and third-party candidates .
#Text=These prospects represent a variety of views that may not be acknowledged by the major party platforms .

#Text=Wikinews has reached out to these candidates throughout the campaign and now presents an interview with Donald K. Allen of Youngstown , Ohio , an independent presidential candidate who registered with the Federal Election Committee in January 2007 .
#Text=He says that his three major policies are " 1 .

#Text=With Edmund Burke 's  The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing " encouraging me , I chose to challenge the two Goliath political parties and run as an independent , unaffiliated candidate for President of the United States of America .

column1: #Text=On the economy
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=For many voters , the government 's proposed $ 700 billion dollar bail out of banks is a very important issue .
#Text=What is your opinion on the bail out ?
#Text=Donald K. Allen : If our government decides to bail out a private corporation 's failure it will set a precedent for other bailouts , which will surely ruin our economy .
#Text=Where will the money come from ?
#Text=Just print more Federal Reserve Notes that have nothing backing them up , or borrow it from China and the Middle East ?

#Text=I hope Congress rejects this proposal , because if it is passed our great grandchildren will inherit the debt , and inflation in this country will increase from the dilution of $ 700 billion into the economy .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) What do you think is the best way to address the current economic crisis ?
#Text=Donald K. Allen : Let the private sector do the rescue , not the government .
#Text=There is nothing in the Constitution that allows for or even hints at this action , and national security is not a justification .
